question_stem.en: A 29-year-old male is hospitalized with low-grade fever and high serum levels of alanine aminotransferase (ALT) and aspartate aminotransferase (AST). His serum is positive for HBsAg.
question_stem.zh: 一名29岁的男性因低热入院，血清中丙氨酸转氨酶 (ALT) 和天冬氨酸转氨酶 (AST) 水平升高。他的血清 HBsAg 呈阳性。

question.en: You should inform the patient that the most likely outcome for his infection would be:
question.zh: 您应该告知患者，他感染最有可能的结局是：

D.en: Chronic hepatitis with progression to cirrhosis
D.zh: 慢性肝炎进展为肝硬化

E.en: Chronic hepatitis with progression to hepatocellular carcinoma
E.zh: 慢性肝炎进展为肝细胞癌

explanation.en:
Hepatitis B virus infection can produce one of three syndromes: acute hepatitis with complete resolution; chronic hepatitis (with or without cirrhosis and the attendant increased risk of hepatocellular carcinoma); or fulminant hepatitis with massive liver necrosis. By far the most common outcome in HBV-infected adults (> 95%) is acute hepatitis with mild or subclinical symptoms that eventually completely resolve.

(Choice B) Fulminant hepatitis occurs in < 1% of patients who develop acute hepatitis.

(Choice C) Only 4-5% of patients with hepatitis B virus infection will go on to develop chronic hepatitis. Of those, 50-80% will remain stable with no evidence of cirrhosis.

(Choice D) Approximately 20-50% of patients with chronic hepatitis B infection will also eventually develop cirrhosis.

(Choice E) Hepatocellular carcinoma arises in 10% of patients with chronic hepatitis and cirrhosis.

Educational Objective:
The most common outcome in HBV-infected adults (> 95%) is acute hepatitis with mild or subclinical symptoms that eventually completely resolve.
explanation.zh:
乙型肝炎病毒感染可产生三种综合征之一：急性肝炎完全缓解；慢性肝炎（伴或不伴肝硬化和相关的肝细胞癌风险增加）；或暴发性肝炎伴大量肝坏死。迄今为止，HBV 感染成人最常见的结局 (> 95%) 是急性肝炎，症状轻微或亚临床，最终完全缓解。

(选项 B) 暴发性肝炎发生在 < 1% 的发生急性肝炎的患者中。

(选项 C) 只有 4-5% 的乙型肝炎病毒感染患者会发展为慢性肝炎。在这些患者中，50-80% 的患者将保持稳定，无肝硬化迹象。

(选项 D) 大约 20-50% 的慢性乙型肝炎感染患者最终也会发展为肝硬化。

(选项 E) 肝细胞癌发生在 10% 的慢性肝炎和肝硬化患者中。

教育目标：HBV 感染成人最常见的结局 (> 95%) 是急性肝炎，症状轻微或亚临床，最终完全缓解。

summary.en:
This question tests knowledge of the natural history and prognosis of acute hepatitis B virus (HBV) infection. It assesses the understanding of the likelihood of different outcomes, including complete resolution, chronic hepatitis, fulminant hepatitis, cirrhosis, and hepatocellular carcinoma.

The best approach is to recall the typical course of acute HBV infection in adults. The majority of adults with acute HBV infection experience complete resolution. Understanding the relative frequencies of the other outcomes helps in selecting the most likely scenario.
summary.zh:
这道题测试对急性乙型肝炎病毒 (HBV) 感染的自然病史和预后的了解。它评估了对不同结局可能性的理解，包括完全缓解、慢性肝炎、暴发性肝炎、肝硬化和肝细胞癌。

最好的方法是回忆成人急性 HBV 感染的典型病程。大多数患有急性 HBV 感染的成人会完全缓解。了解其他结局的相对频率有助于选择最可能的情况。
